Tasks.Task Description: Identify the security requirements for accessing Azure virtual machines through Azure Bastion. Determine compliance needs and security policies.
Design the architecture for Azure Bastion deployment, including network topology, virtual network integration, and subnet configurations.
Create a virtual network and a dedicated subnet for Azure Bastion. Ensure the subnet is named 'AzureBastionSubnet' and meets Azure requirements.
Provision the Azure Bastion service in the created virtual network. Configure the necessary settings for secure access to virtual machines.
Create and configure NSGs to control inbound and outbound traffic to the Azure Bastion subnet. Define rules to restrict access based on security policies.
Enable security features such as Azure Bastion's built-in protection against port scanning and brute-force attacks. Configure session timeout settings.
Set up RBAC to manage access to Azure Bastion. Assign roles to users and groups based on the principle of least privilege.
Configure Azure Monitor and Azure Log Analytics to collect logs and metrics from Azure Bastion. Set up alerts for suspicious activities.
Perform security testing, including penetration testing and vulnerability assessments, to identify potential security weaknesses in the Azure Bastion setup.
Document the security policies, procedures, and configurations related to Azure Bastion. Ensure that all team members are aware of security practices.
Regularly review and update security configurations and policies for Azure Bastion to adapt to new threats and compliance requirements.
